common.phaseBannerHTML: This is a new service – your feedback will help us to improve it.

permitType.defaultTitle: What type of permit or certificate are you applying for?
permitType.pageHeader: What type of permit or certificate are you applying for?
permitType.radioOptionImportHint: To move a species into Great Britain from another country.
permitType.radioOptionExportHint: To move a species out of Great Britain to another country.
permitType.radioOptionReexportHint: To move a species that has already been imported into Great Britain to another country.
permitType.radioOptionArticle10Hint: To use any CITES annex A specimen for commercial purposes.

errorMessages.error.permitType.any.required: Select the type of permit or certificate that you are applying for

cannotUseService.link: Check how to apply for other CITES permits and certificates

applyingOnBehalf.pageBody2: Select ‘no’ if you are completing this application on behalf of yourself, your business or the business that you work for.

selectDeliveryAddress.radioOptionDeliverToDifferentAddress: Deliver the permit to a different address

speciesName.defaultTitle: What is the scientific name of the species?
speciesName.pageHeader: What is the scientific name of the species?
speciesName.bodyText1: Enter the exact scientific name. You can search for the scientific name on species+ (opens in a new tab).
speciesName.bodyText2: If you are applying for a hybrid species, enter the full species name; for example, 'Falco peregrinus x Falco cherrug' or 'Porites spp'. If the species isn't recognised, contact us for assistance.

couldNotConfirm.pageTitle: We could not confirm the scientific name
couldNotConfirm.pageHeader: We could not confirm the scientific name
couldNotConfirm.bodyText1: We could not confirm the scientific name ‘
couldNotConfirm.bodyText2: ’ on the species list. You can
couldNotConfirm.linkText: check scientific names on species+ (opens in a new tab)

animal.radioOptionRHint: Reared in a controlled environment (taken as eggs or juveniles from the wild)
animal.radioOptionDHint: Animals bred in captivity by a CITES registered breeder
animal.radioOptionCHint: Animals bred in captivity to second generation specimens or that meet the Commission Regulation criteria (opens in a new tab)
animal.radioOptionFHint: Animals born in captivity to first generation specimens or that do not meet the Commission Regulation criteria (opens in a new tab)

anotherSourceCodes.text: R - Reared in a controlled environment (taken as eggs or juveniles from the wild)
D - Animals bred in captivity by a CITES registered breeder
C - Animals bred in captivity to second generation specimens or that meet the Commission Regulation criteria
F - Animals born in captivity to first generation specimens or that do not meet the Commission Regulation criteria
X - Taken from the marine environment

errorMessages.error.enterAReason.string.pattern.base: Reason must only include letters a to z, numbers 0 to 9, and special characters such as hyphens, spaces and apostrophes
errorMessages.error.enterAReason.string.max: Reason must be 300 characters or less

plant.radioOptionDHint: Plants artificially propagated for commercial purposes
plant.radioOptionAHint: Plants artificially propagated for non-commercial purposes
plant.radioOptionYHint: Plants that meet the definition for assisted production (opens in a new tab)

anotherSourceCodes.text: D - Plants artificially propagated for commercial purposes
A - Plants artificially propagated for non-commercial purposes
X - Taken from the marine environment
Y - Plants that meet the definition for assisted production

errorMessages.error.enterAReason.string.max: Reason must be 300 characters or less

purposeCode.radioOptionBHint: Breeding in captivity or artificial propagation
purposeCode.radioOptionNHint: Reintroduction or introduction into the wild

useCertificateFor.defaultTitle: What will you use the certificate for?
useCertificateFor.pageHeader: What will you use the certificate for?
useCertificateFor.radioOptionLegallyAcquired: To prove that you legally acquired a specimen
useCertificateFor.radioOptionCommercialActivities: To use the specimen for commercial activities
useCertificateFor.radioOptionOther: To use the specimen for science, breeding, propagation, research, education or other non-detrimental purposes
useCertificateFor.radioOptionMoveALiveSpecimen: To move a live specimen within Great Britain

errorMessages.error.useCertificateFor.any.required: Select what you will use the certificate for

specimenType.radioOptionAnimalWorked: A worked item or finished product
specimenType.radioOptionPlantProductHint: Any plant body or part that was removed from its natural habitat to make a product. For example, seeds, fruits, roots, stems, flowers or leaves, including extracts or powders.
specimenType.radioOptionPlantWorked: A worked item or finished product
specimenType.radioOptionPlantWorkedHint: A specimen that has been significantly altered from its natural raw state and used for items such as furniture, jewellery, carved figures or musical instruments.

errorMessages.error.specimenType.any.only: Select what best describes the specimen
errorMessages.error.specimenType.any.required: Select what best describes the specimen

uploadSupportingDocuments.pageBody1: You should add any documents that may support your application. For example, you can upload:

bulletList1Items.bulletListItem: an Article 10 certificate for the specimen’s parents
proof of ownership or how you acquired the specimen

uploadSupportingDocuments.agentBulletListItem: permission to act on the applicant’s behalf
uploadSupportingDocuments.pageBody2: You can upload a total of 10 files. Files must be smaller than 10MB and either:
uploadSupportingDocuments.spanNoFilesUploaded: You have not uploaded any files

errorMessages.error.fileUpload.hapi.headers.content-ty: The selected file must be a word document, pdf, jpeg or png
errorMessages.error.fileUpload.any.custom: A file with this name has already been uploaded

errorMessages.error.file.delete.exception: The selected file could not be removed – try again
errorMessages.error.fileUpload.any.filesize: The selected file must be smaller than 10MB

applicationSummary.rowTextLegallyAcquired: To prove that you legally acquired a specimen
applicationSummary.rowTextCommercialActivities: To use the specimen for commercial activities
applicationSummary.rowTextOther: To use the specimen for science, breeding, propagation, research, education or other non-detrimental purposes
applicationSummary.rowTextMoveALiveSpecimen: To move a live specimen within Great Britain
applicationSummary.headerPermitDetailsFromExportIntoGreatBr: Permit details from export into Great Britain
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeR: Reared in a controlled environment (taken as eggs or juveniles from the wild)
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeDAnimal: Animals bred in captivity by a CITES registered breeder
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeDPlant: Plants artificially propagated for commercial purposes
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeC: Animals bred in captivity to second generation specimens or that meet the Commission Regulation criteria
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeF: Animals born in captivity to first generation specimens or that do not meet the Commission Regulation criteria
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeA: Plants artificially propagated for non-commercial purposes
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeY: Plants that meet the definition for assisted production
applicationSummary.rowTextPurposeCodeB: Breeding in captivity or artificial propagation
applicationSummary.rowTextPurposeCodeN: Reintroduction or introduction into the wild
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenTypeAnimalWorked: A worked item or finished product
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenTypePlantWorked: A worked item or finished product

paid.pageBody1: We have received your application fee and have sent you a confirmation email.
paid.pageBody2: We have passed your application to the APHA team for endangered plant and animal species (CITES). APHA aims to process your application within 30 days. They may contact you if they require more information.
paid.pageBody3: To view the status of your application, go to your CITES account.

notPaid.pageBody1: We have passed your application to the APHA team for endangered plant and animal species (CITES).
notPaid.pageBody2: They will contact you to confirm the amount you need to pay.
notPaid.pageBody3: To view the status of your application, go to your CITES account.

privacy.heading2: What personal data is collected, and how it is used
privacy.heading3: How your data has been obtained
privacy.heading4: Why Defra and APHA are using your data
privacy.heading5: The legal basis for processing your data
privacy.heading6: A law-based requirement to provide personal data
privacy.heading7: What happens if you do not provide the necessary data
privacy.heading8: Who Defra and APHA share your data with
privacy.heading10: How long Defra and APHA hold personal data
privacy.pageBodyText1: The data controller is the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra). The Animal and Plant Health Agency (APHA), an executive agency of Defra will collect your data.
privacy.pageBodyText2: If you have any questions about how Defra uses your data or your associated rights, email Defra’s Data Protection Manager data.protection@Defra.gov.uk
privacy.pageBodyText3: The Data Protection Officer responsible for monitoring that Defra is meeting the requirements of the legislation can be contacted by email at: DefraGroupDataProtectionOfficer@Defra.gov.uk.
privacy.pageBodyText4: Defra and APHA will use personal data that you or someone authorised to act on your behalf provide. The personal data that we process are your name, email address and postal address. We also process details of your CITES specimen to:

bulletList1Items.bulletListItem: issue a CITES permit where applicable
comply with and enforce the CITES international agreement

privacy.pageBodyText5: If you complete a registration or application on behalf of someone else, we will also collect and process your name, email address and postal address.
privacy.pageBodyText6: We have obtained your data from your application for CITES permits to move or trade endangered species. This data is provided either from you directly or someone authorised to act on your behalf.
privacy.pageBodyText7: When you apply for CITES permits to move or trade endangered species, we will use your data to check that you comply with and to enforce the agreement.
privacy.pageBodyText8: This means that we will keep official records of your compliance history as evidence. For purposes of enforcing CITES, we may share your data with other parties including JNCC, Kew and Border Force.
privacy.pageBodyText9: We will share your data when we review your application, so that an expert from our scientific authorities can assess the application.

bulletList2Items.bulletListItem: contact you or someone acting on your behalf to request further information on the application
contact you to tell you an application has been made on your behalf
contact you if we suspect that your specimen does not comply with CITES
check that you or someone acting on your behalf complies with CITES

privacy.pageBodyText11: Where APHA uses your data to help develop an assessor’s expertise, the legal basis for this data-use is described in Article 6 (1) (a) of the UK General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Article 6 (1) (a) relates to processing your data where you have freely and voluntarily given consent for your data to be used for that purpose.
privacy.pageBodyText12: Where APHA uses your data to check that the specimen complies with CITES, the legal basis for this data use is described in Article 6 (1) (e) of the UK GDPR. Article 6 (1) (e) relates to the processing of your data necessary for the exercise of official authority vested in the controller (Defra and APHA).
privacy.pageBodyText13: Defra and APHA are official authorities and make up a UK government department that has official responsibility for regulating the implementation and application of CITES.
privacy.pageBodyText14: Consent to process your data to help further the expertise of the prescribed institution. You can withdraw your consent at any time before your data is shared with an expert assessor to help them to further their expertise.
privacy.pageBodyText15: You are required by law to provide your data to APHA so they can ensure that any movement or trade of endangered species is compliant with CITES. There is a statutory requirement for you to provide your personal data.
privacy.pageBodyText16: Without necessary data, we will not be able to process your application for a permit. You will not be able to move or trade the specimen within your application.
privacy.pageBodyText17: We will share your data with the assessor who assesses the application to give their expert opinion on whether the item meets the exemption criteria.
privacy.pageBodyText18: Your personal data is shared with assessors to review your application, as well as third parties including JNCC, Kew and Border Force.
privacy.pageBodyText19: We will not share your data with any other third parties, except where we are required to do so by law or court order, to detect or prevent crime, or to apprehend or prosecute offenders.
privacy.pageBodyText20: Personal data may be stored or hosted in Ireland.
privacy.pageBodyText21: Under CITES, there is a statutory requirement for us to hold data on CITES where an applicant has applied for a permit. This application would have been under the provisions governing exemptions in the agreement.
privacy.pageBodyText22: Personal data will be held for seven years from the date we receive your application. It will be reviewed to determine whether a further retention period is required to ensure compliance with and appropriate enforcement of CITES. Data will be manually deleted once it has been determined it is appropriate to do so.
privacy.pageBodyText23: Find out about your individual rights under the UK General Data Protection Regulation (UK GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018 (DPA 2018).
privacy.pageBodyText24: You have the right to make a complaint to the Information Commissioner’s Office at any time.
privacy.pageBodyText25: Defra’s personal information charter, which also applies to APHA’s use of personal data, explains more about your rights over your personal data. This Charter broadly sets out Defra’s standards for requesting or storing personal information.

cookies.pageBody1: Cookies are small files saved on your phone, tablet or computer when you visit a website.
cookies.pageBody2: We use cookies to make CITES work and collect information about how you use our service.
cookies.pageBody3: Essential cookies keep your information secure while you use CITES. We do not need to ask permission to use them.
cookies.tableRow2: To store details you enter on this site
